definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Count or remove the central government selections, can make holding that skin owes area and decline.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府的选点或迁移，能造皮该区域的盛与衰。

sentences.english: We had chosen several regions, but gave all of them up at last.
sentences.chinese: 我们选点了几个地区，最后还是放弃了。

sentences.english: We would suggest an alternative souvenir next time.
sentences.chinese: 不过，我们建议乘客下次最好选点别的纪念品。

sentences.english: The spherical surfaces defined by several arbitrarily chosen points are all concentric.
sentences.chinese: 凡是由几个任意选点确定的球面都是同心面。

sentences.english: Construction agriculture is new and high area of technical demonstrative garden, want above all good choose a dot to close.
sentences.chinese: 建设农业高新技术示范园区，首先要把好选点关。

sentences.english: Richard: Can I help you find anything today, ladies?
sentences.chinese: 两位女士，我能帮你们选点什么吗？

definition: to order à la carte/single point (of measurement, mounting etc)
(idiom) to use methods in line with local circumstances
to go and inspect (a site)/to do an on-site survey
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
